attributes.action: Denounce muslim concentration camps in China, bring in appropriate sanctions
attributes.additional_details:
Looking back on world war 2 and nazi concentration camps, as a country and as individuals we agreed we would not sit by and let it happen again; however, this has the capacity to grow into a situation equally or more severe.
Muslims are being put in 're-education' centres to try and convert them. This is a clear breach of human rights and one can only imagine the rates of illness, death and neglect in these camps.
The government has a moral duty as a leading world power to make a difference
attributes.background:
The British government should become a leading foreign power in the denouncement of muslim concentration camps in China, this includes:
 - Publicly denouncing what is happening
 - Become a leading voice in international parliaments
 - Issue appropriate sanctions and punishments

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300146
